detaileddescription.para: data about the peer node node_public_key from the hello message, zero-initialized before we get the hello

the unique identifier we'll use to refer to the node with. zero-initialized before we receive the hello message, at which time it will be filled with either the "node_id" from the user_data field of the hello, or if none is present it will be filled with a copy of node_public_key

briefdescription.para: The inbound endpoint of the remote peer (our best guess)
Some nodes may be listening on multiple endpoints.
Potential inbound endpoints of the peer.

detaileddescription.para: ID of items in the blockchain that this peer has told us about
List of all items this peer has offered use that we've already handed to the client but the client hasn't finished processing

briefdescription.para: Number of items in the blockchain that follow ids_of_items_to_get but the peer hasn't yet told us their IDs.
We check this to detect a timed-out request and in busy()

detaileddescription.para: The time we received the last sync item or the time we sent the last batch of sync item requests to this peer

briefdescription.para: IDs of blocks we've requested from this peer during sync. Fetch from another peer if this peer disconnects.
The hash of the last block this peer has told us about that the peer knows.

memberdef.type: boost::multi_index_container< timestamped_item_id, boost::multi_index::indexed_by< boost::multi_index::hashed_unique< boost::multi_index::member< timestamped_item_id, item_id, &timestamped_item_id::item >, std::hash< item_id > >, boost::multi_index::ordered_non_unique< boost::multi_index::tag< timestamp_index >, boost::multi_index::member< timestamped_item_id, fc::time_point_sec, &timestamped_item_id::timestamp > > > >
memberdef.definition: using graphene::net::peer_connection::timestamped_items_set_type = boost::multi_index_container< timestamped_item_id, boost::multi_index::indexed_by< boost::multi_index::hashed_unique< boost::multi_index::member<timestamped_item_id, item_id, &timestamped_item_id::item>, std::hash<item_id> >, boost::multi_index::ordered_non_unique< boost::multi_index::tag<timestamp_index>, boost::multi_index::member<timestamped_item_id, fc::time_point_sec, &timestamped_item_id::timestamp> > > >
memberdef.name: timestamped_items_set_type

detaileddescription.para: Items we've requested from this peer during normal operation. Fetch from another peer if this peer disconnects

briefdescription.para: If in this state, we have sent a hello_message.

detaileddescription.para: Remote side has sent us a connection_accepted, we're operating normally with them
Remote side has sent us a connection_rejected, we may be exchanging address with them or may just be waiting for them to close

briefdescription.para: We have not yet received a hello_message.
We have sent them a connection_accepted.
We have sent them a connection_rejected.

memberdef.type: std::queue< std::unique_ptr< queued_message >, std::list< std::unique_ptr< queued_message > > >
memberdef.name: _queued_messages

briefdescription.para: true while we're in the middle of handling a message from the remote system
Whether we're waiting for an address message.
Use this instead of the constructor.
